title: Directs New York city board of education to provide school attendants on school buses
summary: Directs the New York city board of education to place school attendants on school buses transporting children in grades kindergarten through grade eight.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2047

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the education law, in relation to requiring the board of
education in the city of New York to provide school bus attendants

SUMMARY:
This bill directs the New York City Board of Education to
provide school bus attendants on all school buses transporting
students in kindergarten through eighth grade.

JUSTIFICATION:
Approximately thirty percent of children
in New York City ride on school buses which are overcrowded. Most
buses allow 60 students seated and 12 standees. Some elementary
school principals have complained that the lack of supervision on
these crowded buses has caused chaotic conditions for the students.
Confrontations, littering, and outbursts are commonplace. Therefore,
supervision is needed on the buses to attend to these needs. School
bus attendants provide a definite deterrent to these activities in
other districts around the State. Children who ride school buses in
New York City are entitled to the same supervision.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
The first of September after it has become a law.
